title: Digital Public Library of America communications

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

As background information, on 4/22/2022, I submitted a request with tracking number  NARA-NGC-2022-001048. I requested all emails to or from NARA from the external domain @dp.la. This was eventually rejected as overly broad—which I object to, as my belief is it would only have amounted to a few dozen emails, and I was given no answer to my follow up to understand the difficulty. In any case, in the rejection from NARA, the following was stated:

"However, the requester needs to be specific in identifying the type of record; the topic or subject covered by the record, and an approximate date for the record. The FOIA does not require agencies to conduct research, answer questions, or analyze data. Your request does not give the information necessary to identify potentially Federal responsive records. Could you please provide a specific department (within NARA) that you believe may have communicated with the organization cited in your FOIA request?"

In response, I would like to narrow/reformulate my request to emails with specific keywords found only in emails to/from specific NARA staff email addresses, within a limited date range. Please see this more limited list of 10 NARA employees:

* Hannah Bergman <hannah.bergman@nara.gov>
* Jason Clingerman <jason.clingerman@nara.gov>
* David Ferriero <david.ferriero@nara.gov> or <archivistoftheunitedstates@nara.gov>
* Valorie Findlater <valorie.findlater@nara.gov>
* Carol Lagundo <carol.lagundo@nara.gov>
* Maureen MacDonald <maureen.macdonald@nara.gov>
* Gary M. Stern <garym.stern@nara.gov>
* Debra Wall <debra.wall@nara.gov>
* Andrew Wilson <andrew.wilson@nara.gov>
* Pamela Wright <pamela.wright@nara.gov>

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All emails, including attachments, sent to or from the above listed NARA staff members, from the period of August 1, 2019 to December 31 , 2020 which contain the terms "Digital Public Library of America" or "DPLA".

2. Google Chat messages from the same individuals and same time frame with the matching search terms, as well as the 10 messages occurring before or after them (to capture the context).

Because NARA is a member of the association being searched for, I have reason to believe there will be responsive records. I do not believe the number will be excessive, because this is not a major component of NARA's work, but if you still believe the request needs to be narrowed, despite the very specific ways in which I have already given parameters for the document search, then I would appreciate additional details as to what makes it excessive (e.g. if a search was done and what the number of emails was).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

TR

title: Department of Labor - Women's Bureau: Trump Administration Removal of "The Impact of Gender and Racial Inequality on Women Workers" Blog Post

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Internal communications, including but not limited to emails, memos, and directives regarding any removal, modification, or restriction to public access to a blog titled, "The Impact of Gender and Racial Inequality On Women Workers" which was previously located at https://www.dol.gov/agencies/wb/impact/stories

A snapshot of this page, which includes testimonials from various women, was saved by the Internet Archive's Way back Machine: https://web.archive.org/web/20241218091106/https://www.dol.gov/agencies/wb/impact/stories

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello,

I request that the department's virtual reality training program be inspected in person. The program's details, including how it works, how it is used, and other details of the technology, can only be viewed in person. 

7922.570.  

(a) Unless otherwise prohibited by law, any agency that has information that constitutes an identifiable public record not exempt from disclosure pursuant to this division that is in an electronic format shall make that information available in an electronic format when requested by any person.

(b) When applicable, the agency shall do the following:

(1) The agency shall make the information available in any electronic format in which it holds the information.

Please let me know the department's availability so I can inspect the record in person.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

title: LAUSD, SDUSD, and Fresno USD CSSP 4.23.25 (Los Angeles Unified School District)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All finalized Comprehensive School Safety Plans submitted from 2018 to present in a word or .pdf file. I would also like a compiled excel sheet of all the Comprehensive School Safety Plans on Section 32282 reporting, specifically Section (M)(i) regarding "Procedures to respond to incidents involving an individual experiencing a sudden cardiac arrest or a similar life-threatening medical emergency while on school grounds."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sejal Parekh

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please conduct a search for responsive records and hereby request the following:

Any and all records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation into Nicholas "Sonny" MAURO

Nicholas "Sonny" MAURO'S Date  of death was June 22, 2005. Here is a link to his obituary in the Buffalo News: https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/buffalonews/name/nicholas-mauro-obituary?id=4666898 ...I have attached a screenshot. 

Please include any and all surveillance pictures and charts containing  and/or referring to Nicholas "Sonny" MAURO

In addition to conducting this search for records at the FBI Field Office in Buffalo, NY, please conduct an additional search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center. 

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. 

If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mob

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CPS: Principal Personnel Files, 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals:

* Jason Roberts, Interim Principal
* David T Stachowiak, Assistant Principal
* Lidia Paredes, Assistant Principal  

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements/agreements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements.

This request is on behalf of The FOIA Bakery, an Illinois nonprofit. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

title: CA CVR Data Request (2014, 2016, 2018) (Orange County, California Registrar Of Voters)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: CA CVR Data Request (2014, 2016, 2018) (Orange County, California Registrar Of Voters)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2014 Nov Midterm Elections
2. 2016 Nov General Election
3. 2018 Nov Midterm Election

Specifically, for each of these elections, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast generated by the relevant voting system technology in Orange County in that year. Alameda County has an example of these records posted for the 2024 General Election on their Election Information for November 2024 under the name “Cast Vote Records (CVR) Report”. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: CA CVR Data Request (2014, 2016, 2018) (Los Angeles County Registrar-Recorder/County Clerk)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2014 Nov Midterm Elections
2. 2016 Nov General Election
3. 2018 Nov Midterm Election

Specifically, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast in each election as generated by the relevant voting system technology used in LA County. Alameda County has an example of these records posted for the 2024 General Election on their Election Information for November 2024 under the name “Cast Vote Records (CVR) Report”.
